DOC.detailed_description: Children depress parent risk develop social-emotional problem . Despite fact economic hardship strong risk factor maternal depression poor child development , little research conduct develop prevention program low-income urban family . This randomized , open-label study address research gap develop pilot-testing Protecting Families Program ( PFP ) , family-based , multi-component prevention program . The PFP offer service low-income , urban , depressed parent child age 9 14 . Prior interventional portion study , several small focus group compose mental-health care provider depress parent meet . The purpose focus group gather information help maximize effectiveness remainder study . The interventional phase compare PFP combine individual parent training versus parent train alone . Participants randomly assign one two intervention group . The study last total 10 week . Both group meet week . PFP include community meal beginning session , parent skill train group , concurrent cognitive behavioral therapy ( CBT ) group focal child . Participants ' symptom , diagnosis , functional status , family functioning , cognitive factor , parent practice assess study start date , immediately post-intervention , 6 month post-intervention .
